Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near the train station.”
Reviews.Author: oldyuman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on two occasions during our recent trip to Italy. The location is very convenient to the main train station. In fact we just walked there dragging our numerous suitcases. You can reach some of the attractions in the hisorical district with a little walking (we walked back from the Spanish Steps as well as Campo Fiornian). It is not a bad hotel, just that some of the rooms are old and in need of upgrade. The first visit we had a recently renovated room and it was a solid three star room. The second visit we had an older, smaller room, but it served the purpose of an overnight stay before heading home. Breakfast are not great, corn flakes, stale cheese, baloney, and no eggs. Coffee was good and plentiful though. All the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. We left our key in the door by mistake one evening, returning many hours later and found nothing disturbed. A safe, solid two-three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bad bed, dirty bathroom, crack floor & dirty, tiny tv”
Reviews.Author: Moose12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel recently. The location is good as it is near the subway, train and bus stations. However, it is not a 3 stars hotel per its website or per hotel.com rating. It is a 2 or 1 stars per north america hotel ratings or at least based on numerous north american and asian hotels I stayed in past 30 yrs. Reasons include: very uncomfortable sleep with a thin & old matress (about 4 inches thick) on horizontal springs sagging in the middle and we were told that all the beds in the hotels are like that when we asked for another bed or room; tiny tv; cracked bathroom floor; no face towel; no shower curtain; and dirty towel not picked up and replaced. We defintely do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but Clean”
Reviews.Author: Sofanon
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night on short notice, and Nizza was available, at a good price, one block from the Termini train station. The staff was very helpful (spoke excellent English), the hotel and room were clean ( with one exception). They provided a continental breakfast 7-9 am. The room was spacious, had an older TV, a bar, a large chair, and a large bed. The door locks are primitive and awkward. The ceramic bathroom had a tub but no shower, lighting was dim, and the floor looked like it needed a good scrubbing. This was once an elegant hotel, but it appeared tired. It is decorated with modern sculptures throughout -- an odd choice. The neighborhood was good. They had wi-fi, but you have to go to a nearby internet cafe if you have no computer. Overall, I would stay there again, simply because of the cost and convenience to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: oh_my_sunshine
Reviews.Content: I've learnt my lesson. I should've checked the reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor before booking. This was the worst hotel (if you can even call it a hotel) that I've stayed in all my travels. The room was old, there were stains on the wall, our bed covers had cigarette burn holes on them, the bath doesn't drain properly, the staff were rude and unhelpful, and the list goes on. I just felt so uncomfortable in there that I had trouble sleeping. The only saving grace of this hotel is that it's close to Termini station. My suggestion is that you pay a little more and stay at all the other and better choices nearby. This hotel has given me such a bad taste of Rome. You've been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the value”
Reviews.Author: Lefteris M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 2 days and Hotel Nizza was very affordable and in a very convenient location. The room was clean but there was some hair on the sheets so we requested new sheets and they gave us immediately. I didn't like that every time we were going out we had to give our room key at the reception. Overall it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel.”
Reviews.Author: teudatole
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Some rooms are large and some are very small. Very helpfull staff. There is a hairdrier in room. Good location. A bit expencive for it's class.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute worst hotel of my life”
Reviews.Author: Andosan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the worst I have ever stayed at in my life. I had the unfortunate luck of spending two nightmarious evenings in this hole in the wall. The staff especially a east Indian guy I found to be very rude and snarky. if I see him on the streets I'll likely hit him in the face. The room itself is something out of a horror movie. The building was probably built and last renovated when julius ceaser was in power. The walls were mouldy, the sink was broken, the bed sheets had cigarette holes in them, walls were dirty and those may have been some of the nicer features! Do yourself a favor and do not check into this place, many have experienced similar or worst than myself and my partner.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience ever”
Reviews.Author: danny10n
Reviews.Content: I have never received such awful service in my life. I had booked 1 room for 3 guests and upon arrival our 3rd guests was not allowed entry. We explained that we had booked a room for 3 but they said they were full and only had a room for 2. We asked if we could get a cot for the 3rd person and they refused because "the room was too small". This was ridiculous as the room we did have was certainly large enough for 3 people and multiple cots. I asked to be refunded so we could find somewhere else that could accommodate the rest of us and they again refused. Our 3rd guest was not even allowed to come up to the room with us while we figured out what to do. In the end our 3rd guest had to book a room in another hotel 20 minutes away. I have never been treated so poorly in my life. I travel quite frequently throughout the world and I can honestly say Hotel Nizza is the worst hotel I have ever been to. Other bad points...near train station but neighborhood is dirty and not safe. Room had no shower head and we needed to bathe from a hose. Room was in need of renovations, paint, etc.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: USCAngel22
Reviews.Content: If your trying to save a couple of dollars stay somewhere else, or just add the $20 a night and stay somewhere worth it. The bed had bed bugs, our bathroom door got stuck closed for several hours, and the staff was rude, they wouldn't let me charge the room to the visa I wanted to charge it to. They had no maintenance on staff to open bathroom door, so I basically had to hold my pee until I went downstairs and demanded another room to shower, brush my teeth, and use the restroom in after several hours. This is an option any hotel with some customer service would have offered. The man got an attitude with me. I was appalled. On top of that, the room he gave me to shower in had a plethora of mold on the walls, so bad that it smelled. The staff are very rude and short. The hotel is an awesome location being that its right next to the train station but so is Hotel Uno & The Radisson along with some other hotels. I had a blast in Rome it is a beautiful & fun city. However, I wouldn't stay at this hotel again if they offered it for FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, clean and cheap and very kind staff.”
Reviews.Author: Fesile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nizza for 5 days. Room is clean and big enough. Room service is good. Elevatior is small but it is ok for two person. Very kind and helpful staff. Location is too close to termini station and you can go historical places by walking about 10 min. Price is cheaper. We did not have breakfast there, there are restaurants and snackbars by 2 min. Walking. There is No shower curtain in bath.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tomasz1010
Reviews.Content: On 1 May 2011 evening I came to Hotel Nizza to make a reservation for the end of May. The young man at the desk asked for my credit card to make the reservation. Unfortunately I was too tired to ask him to give it back to me. I had landed in Rome after an overnight flight just a few hours ago. When I realized what happened the next morning, I immediately went back to Hotel Nizza, but no credit card was found. After contacting the credit card services, I found out that about 900 dollars had been taken out during the night. I have absolutely no doubt about what happened. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Good VFM”
Reviews.Author: AbhishekG_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: Booked in the last minute @ hotelclub.com for extending our Rome trip by a day. Was totally worth the deal we got. Our other hotel was also close by so did not have hassels checking out of one and checking in to Nizza. Its location is perfect – close to the termini train station. For anyone whose traveled Europe I guess the best tip is to stay close to the train stations. Try and pick up the rooms at the top and not at the ground level to have a peaceful stay. Hotels got recently renovated so don’t worry about some of the bad reviews u might come across. The staff was very friendly was a comfortable typical 3 star hotel. Do try it out for the location if you get a cheap online deal.

Reviews.Title: “:-)”
Reviews.Author: Markocg
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel because rooms was very clean and staff was very helpful. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is falling apart”
Reviews.Author: Caminante32
Reviews.Content: The place is falling apart, no joke. I was very annoyed by the elevator sign asking the guest to climb the stairs instead of using the elevators. But paying 50 Euros at night in March was just ridiculous. I stayed 3 nights only because the rooms were clean and I've made no reservations. Can't really tell about their breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “so happy i did not listen to the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: nirit04
Reviews.Content: my husband and i didnt really know what to do when we read all the bad reviews but thanks to one good review we dicided we go anyway. the room was very small but hey! we didnt need more than that!!! alllll the people in the front desk was very kind and helpfull. the location of the hotel was sooooo goood!!!!! not too clise to the sceary parts of the termini but yet, u can walk to it and it ok. there r a lot good restaurants near the hotel- good for dinner. we had the time of our life. in 5 days we saw romw and we enjoyd it so much. we woke up every morning , ate breakfast, got out of the hotel. got back after noon - siesta........and went out again in the evening. the weather was great! not cold, not hot it wasnt crouded- not too much people fun fun fun

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Swiss_MnM
Reviews.Content: This modest hotel is not the Ritz but so close to the Termini train and metro station that it is my favorite place to stay. Rooms are fine and the bathrooms are small but functional. Breakfast is ok but not stellar and it is best to ask for an espresso from that bar rather than take the coffee they serve. There is some old world charm in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Do not be fooled by mod arty pictures - the rooms are nowhere modern or arty”
Reviews.Author: Highadventurer
Reviews.Content: The inside of the lobby and hall looks impressive with modern art paintings but the rooms are a shocker. I have an inside coiurt facing room and the room was shutter and when opened there was scaffording so the window was totally black out. The place impresses at first look but if you look carefully a lot of things need changing eg curtains, bedspread etcc.. Because the windows and shuttered there is a sense of errieness (ghostly) atmosphere about it. The other thing you need to watch out for is breakfast costs E10 for a very basic cornflakes and pastry and i rather eat at stand cafe where you pay 1 r for a cuppachino and E1 for a chocolate croisant. Hotel of last resort though the proximity to RomA Termini and Plaza Republika with the nearest Mc Donald may be a saving grace but that is nothing to do with the illusion of an arty hotel

Reviews.Title: “Dont`t even think about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vidar95
Reviews.Content: After a week at the Amalfi Coast we came to Rome to stay just one night at the Hotel Nizza. We arrived in the afternoon by train from Salerno. It was one of the hottest day in Rome so far this summer. Coming to the hotel the room was not yet ready - waited apox half an hour and got the worst hotel room I`ve seen so far. The sink was broken, the toilette didn`t work and it was not clean. Complained - and got another room. Here things seemed to be ok although you could clearly see that the room hadt`n been upgraded for a while. We turned on the aircontidion and went for a walk on the city. When we arrived late in the evening - the aircondition did not work. We complained to the receptionist, but no one could help us. I nearly slept that night - and my wife stayed out in the hotel corridor all night where it was a litte bit cooler. When we complained next motning we were told that we probably did not know how to handle the air condition in rhe room. We should have asked for help we were told. We talked to other guests and the had pretty much the same experience. So don`t even think about staying at this hotel when you`re in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nizza: What a Trendy gem of Modern Art!”
Reviews.Author: Bardim
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Nizza with a three nights package special offering. The price I paied, was definetly value for money. It is a cool boutique hotel. I do not understand why there are such negative comments in tripadvisor. I was impressed by the mix between a Modern Art design with a classical style. In the first two floors all the rooms have contemporary paintings, in the last two floors the rooms have classic paintings. The rooms are clean and the atmosphere is so artistique. It seems to sleep inside the MoMa. The staff is gentle and helpfull, and moreover the location is perfect since it is close to Termini station that is the only point of Roma connected with the rest of the city. Believe me, That is an important issue, since Roma it is not the best for public transportation connections. I highly reccomend anyone to try Hotel Nizza.

Reviews.Title: “Do not pay to stay in this falling apart hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NancyInLincoln
Reviews.Content: This reminded me of a falling apart house of your 95 year-old grandma. The furniture was old and beat up like something from a garage sale. The curtains were stained. The walls had water spots and plaster falling off. There were cigarette burns in our bedspread and our kid's sheets were ripped. Our shower would not drain and we had to hold the button on the toilet for two minutes to get it to flush. We did have hot water. The shower was small and had moldy grout. There was a hole in our bathroom door and it looked like someone stuck modeling clay in it to fill it. The elevator could only fit two people with luggage, 4 people without. The staff was reasonably polite, but not very knowledgeable. There was the most bizarre contemporary art hanging with frames that looked like they were wrapped in duct tape and spray painted. I am not sure where the pictures of the hotel that are posted on this website came from, because they make it look much nicer than it actually is. The TV did not work and staff could not come look at it, because there was only one desk clerk there in the evening and they cannot leave.The breakfast was not very good. I'm not sure if I would ever stay here, but most certainly not for the price we paid ($180 per room/per night!...outrageous!). We left after one night and stayed at the Hotel Mediteraneano around the corner...it cost less and was wonderful. The only positives I can think of are that the location was good and the rooms were spacious. The room by us was having problems with their shower and had trouble getting toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “Poor, but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Scincus
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this hotel with a group of eleven persons. The room was simple, but clean. In the hotel a lot of unfinished maintenance, wires etc. It was only possible to get a reasonable wifi connection early in the morning or at night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. One night the (false) fire alarm kept us awake for more then an hour, and nobody of the staff knew what to do. In Rome you do not stay at your room, so you can go to this hotel. Do not expect much, but overall the hotel is acceptable in my opinion. The location near Termini Station is fantastic for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: monisia2009
Reviews.Content: dirty rooms, broken showers, mold everywhere, cuted nails on tile floor, thin bed sheets with holes, terrible food and rude workers. We stayed there 7 days and that was our worst hotel where we stayed. We travel all over Europe and US but what we founf here is not acceptable at all. I wish to take some photos of 4 rooms thay showed to us. None of them was good and cleann. All of them had broken showers, toilets, same bed sheets. If you would like to remember your trip to such amazing citi as Rome make sure you will not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A filthy hole”
Reviews.Author: zorroleeds
Reviews.Content: The only good thing here is the location which is excellent for the station. The hotel stank of cigarettes, the walls were absolutely filthy as were the curtains and furniture. The staff generally were friendly - but service was bizzare and had to be requested at the bar. We didnt go for breakfast it was so dirty. The room was actually quite comfortable although not clean (sheets were fresh though) The bathroom was the pits! Now if a professional hotel chain got hold of this, they could for probably not too much money make this into quite a nice hotel there are some elegant features and the odd antique - but its a filthy hole at the moment I should say, there is a smashing little restaurant across the road.

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace - do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Pablos888
Reviews.Content: Where to start.....my wife and I were on honeymoon in Amalfi and were flying out of Rome so decided to book our last night in Rome for convenience. We booked online for one night at the Hotel Europa, a sister hotel of Hotel Nizza, and on arrival we were told by the receptionist at Hotel Europa that we were staying at Hotel Nizza and she then proceeded to give us directions to Hotel Nizza without explaining why we could not stay at the hotel we had booked. I questioned this as we had clearly booked Hotel Europa and there was nothing in the Terms and Conditions stating that they could transfer us to another hotel. The receptionist said she did not know why we had to go to a different hotel and only when pushed she went to discuss with a colleague, whereupon she returned and explained that Hotel Europa was full. Then why did their website accept further bookings? So we trudged across Rome with our luggage to Hotel Nizza, which looked a bit shabby from outside and in the main reception, but we were tired and just wanted to get out and enjoy the last night of our honeymoon in Rome so we agreed to stay at Hotel Nizza, and the receptionist demanded payment upfront. We questioned this as we had given our credit card information when we booked Hotel Europa online. The receptionist assured us that we would not be double charged and stated that we were getting a bargain paying €68 for a room at Hotel Nizza as they normally charge €170. So we were pleased with this, if a little dubious, and he gave us the key to our room. It subsequently transpired that this was a complete lie, as looking at the Hotel Nizza website, the most expensive room on offer was around €80. When we got to our room, not only was it the pokiest, shabbiest hotel room I have ever seen - it had also not been cleaned since the previous guests had left. So i returned to reception to remonstrate with the receptionist, and I told him we were not staying at the hotel and I asked for a refund of the cash paid in advance. Firstly, the receptionist assured us that there is no way we would find a room at another hotel as they would all be fully booked on the Saturday night we were there. Whilst debating this, he sent someone up to clean the room. I said that I would take my chances finding a hotel elsewhere, and that I really didn't want to spend the last day of my honeymoon in Hotel Nizza, and asked again for my money back. The receptionist said that it was not possible to give a refund on Saturdays because the administration team did not work on weekends, and we could not therefore obtain a refund until Monday. Now, I am no expert on credit card machines, but we disputed this at the time as being complete nonsense - if he can take a payment on Saturday he can also issue a refund. We have subsequently spoken to a number of other people who have confirmed that his assertion was absloute nonsense. So I left my wife in reception whilst the room was being cleaned and went off to another hotel at which we had stayed previously in Rome - Hotel Oceania, just around the corner and contrary to the receptionist's nonsensical ramblings we managed to get a room at Hotel Oceania no problem. I then returned to Hotel Nizza to collect my wife and explained to the receptionist one last time that we were not staying at Hotel Nizza and that i wanted my money back. He maintained that a refund could not be given until Monday, and I said that was no problem, I would wait for the money back so instructed him to refund the money on Monday. He said that he would do this. When we returned to England on Sunday, I emailed Hotel Nizza reminding them to issue the refund, and six weeks down the line, several emails and telephone calls later I have still not had my money back. Hotel Nizza have offered me a free night's stay as compensation - which is laughable as it is a ghastly hotel which would be my last choice of a place to sleep, and it would involve travelling to Italy again to take up their offer!! So whilst, they have basically admitted they owe me, they still refuse to issue the refund and when I threatened them that I would take the issue further they accused me of blackmail and refused to discuss the matter further. I await a detailed response from them as to: 1) Why their receptionist lied and told us that his machine could not issue refunds; 2) Why the receptionist lied and told us that he would issue the refund on Monday; 3) Why the receptionist lied and said that all other hotels in Rome would be fully booked; and 4) Why the receptionist lied about the real cost of the Hotel Nizza rooms. They refuse to answer these questions, hence the reason I have decided to leave this review. Normally, I would not leave feedback on these sites, but felt it my duty in this case, as the lack of service received from Hotel Nizza is shocking and I would really like to prevent other people from visiting (assuming all the other poor reviews on this site do not do the trick!!) I urge everyone reading this site to boycott the hotel which is shabby and completely lacks service quality. The only thing I can't fault the hotel on is location, as it is very convenient for the train station and local eateries - but there are many much nicer hotels in the area surrounding Hotel Nizza. I can highly recommend the Hotel Oceania which is twice as expensive but infinitely nicer!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what the picture looks like at all!”
Reviews.Author: AngieAngie
Reviews.Content: We were off to Italy for some leisure time...me and my family that is. My dad booked this hotel after looking at the pictures, which admittedly make it look quite elegant. Upon arriving it was nothing like it looked like. Dreary, grey and just plain gross. My family of five (dad, mom, and two brothers and me) were put in this room with uncomfortable beds; one single, one double and a bunk bed. We tried to find parking for our van, but they told us to park somewhere blocks away with minimal security. I should mention that the hotel is in a shady part of town, and we left the hotel to grab our suitcases only to find that the main door to our hotel was locked and basically we had to wait outside (with other tourists locked out) until the only employ in the building would hear our knocks and open the door. Obviously not safe in that part of Rome. When this happened we were ready to bolt. The man at the desk was rude and non-caring, we couldn't get our money back, but we wanted to leave, so badly that after a while we just gave up and left. Terrible place...do not go there. The pictures are incredibly misleading...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: MishaBelgrade
Reviews.Content: We spend 6 days in Rome. Rome is a great city to see but "hotel" Nizza is terrible! 3 stars?!? Maybe back in 1965.! The hotel is old, dirty and makes great scenery for some dark movie. Only clean thing in rooms are towels, delivered in early morning by local laundry. Floor was never cleaned in 6 days and "blankets" on the bed were so dirty that we try whole night not to be touched by them, but only by more or less clean sheet. Marble staircases are moving under your feet because they are broken, parts of the wall by the side of the doors are also falling down, there is not enough lightning in the rooms, only hot water in bathroom... Breakfast? What a joke! Cold pastry, ham from tin, not a single kind of cheese or butter, coffee is probably better in prison cantina. One morning , we came at 9:30 (breakfast is 7:30-10:00) and find 2 pastries! Lady,working partly in the kitchen, partly as cleaning stuff is singing with no intentions to add some food. Finally, at the end we give it up like majority of guests in the hotel and start to have breakfast in nearby "gastronomia". Avoid this hotel as strong as you can ! There are very good hotels in just 1 minute walk from "Nizza" and B&B also,and you don't really need something bad as this , to be part of your stay in "Eternal city".

Reviews.Title: “Nizza hotel, Rome, brutal staff”
Reviews.Author: mooner3
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a holiday at the Nizza hotel Rome. The staff of the hotel were hostile, and even tried to attack us physically, after cursing and yelling, not only in Italian, but also in English, by this Indian guy, Ralphie. Our only sin was expressing annoyance about the state of our room, cockroaches all over the place, no hot water at the shower, no air-condition. They behaved brutally to us.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Ticketless55
Reviews.Content: The main complaint we had about this hotel was that there was NO air conditioning or fans in the rooms. We were on the 4th floor and it was the end of June. It was SO hot in our room that it was hard to sleep. The room was clean, the staff was fine. Seemed pretty pricey for what we got/didn't get at $300 a night. We were told by our travel agent that it was location, location, location - but we would have paid anything for some cool air! Thought about switching hotels, but had prepaid the 3 nights so that would have been pointless. The breakfast was limited, but at least it was cool in the basement where it was served. The television didn't work (didn't really care, but it was just one more disappointment).

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Fernando_Maciel
Reviews.Content: This was, by far, the worst hotel where I stayed. I had lowered my expectations when I read some reviews here, but it was very disappointg anyway. The rooms are terribly old and cheap. The sheets altought seens to be clean, where also very old. The room decoration was inexistent, with faded RED walls and cardboard pictures hanged. Fortunatelly I had a room with hot water working perfectly, but I've heard that mine was an exception. Coffee break was also terrible, with artificial juices and rock hard breads. On the plus side: If you are coming to enjoy Rome, this Hotel will help you to know the city, as nobody would want to spend some time on it.

Reviews.Title: “Never go here. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: shermanLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We were sent here when our room at La Griffe (sister hotel) had "water damage." I have learned that "water damage" means the hotel was over booked. It was awful. Awful. I am still itching from that night and wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy. La Griffe is lovely. When we finally were able to check in I was very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: BarryV01
Reviews.Content: Room was large, clean the staff acceptable and it location is close to alot of attractions, but thats as good as it gets. Very run down, no cold water, in November! No shower curtain so floor was knee deep in water after 2 showers which explains the wood rot. Door had been jimmed in the past. Breakfast was terrible, go to the cafe near the fountain they serve American breakfast. Room was hot at night despite turning the heating off and only Italian TV stations on the 12" set. Even at just over 300eruos for 4 nights I think we were had.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Beartrande
Reviews.Content: May have been a 3 star hotel at one time, but more akin to 1 star now. Faded and jaded. The breakfast was bad, lukewarm to cold hideous coffee out of a kettle (not kept warm). One choice of cereal. Pastries quite nice. Only grapefruit juice or water. Total lack of choice that would expect from a reasonable hotel. Bedroom OK, fittings old and some need repair. Difficult to get hot water out of the taps! Couldn't get extra pillows first night due to large group also staying. Location is good, close to Termini station but not too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very central”
Reviews.Author: Flyboyuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a long weekend. The hotel is very central and is ideal for exploring Rome. Clearly the hotel is a little dated and in need of freshing up, but I believe for the price its fine. Dont expect a plush 3 star with all mod cons, its not. But for a basic cheap hotel it has just what you need for exploring beautiful Rome. The breakfast is the usual continental things you would expect and is fine for to start to the day but hey who wants to eat in a hotel anyway when there are loads of lovely coffee shops on your doorstep. The staff were very helpful and polite and spoke perfect English, and did not laugh at my awful Italian. Go, enjoy, dont expect the Hilton and you will be fine!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expected so much worse...”
Reviews.Author: Markie127
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we read the site after booking and decided to go ahead anyway...firstly it is a budget hotel so you do get what you pay for. - -The breakfast is very mediocre -coffee ( awful) and pastries (dry) but if you ask they will make you fresh cappuchino / espresso - the rooms tired / in need of a good spruce up ( lack of decent pillows, but just ask and they will provide more) - the overall decor, needs a good lick of paint - the reception staff were friendly enough, not rude or impolite - the Termini area is a run down and not so pleasant area to be honest but central enough and easy to locate buses, undergound etc. Lots of cheap places to eat. Overall as I mentioned I did expect it to be alot worse ( due to other reviews)than it was in reality - but I wouldn't stay there again unless I had to.

Reviews.Title: “not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: karl2
Reviews.Content: i took my partner to Rome for valentines 2007. I chose to stay at the hotel nizzar as the photos on the net looked nice and it was rated as a 3 star. well lets just say that the photos are not exactly accurate. we found the room to be very "shabby" to say the least... rather uncomfortable and dated. the hotel isnt located in the best place.. its a good half an walk to the spanish steps and the main shopping area. breakfast was basic but edible. the one good point worth mentioning was the recption staff, who were helpful, friendly and knowledgeable of the area. all in all, our stay was "ok" but i am sure there are much nicer hotels in a simular price bracket near by

Reviews.Title: “Oh so bab very bad the hotel dump”
Reviews.Author: pumpyme1
Reviews.Content: After booking my 5 night stay at the nizza my friend told me to come hear and check it out so i did and some people said not so nice things, So i thought i would give it a chance and go anyway bad move this place is a DUMP i have never stayed in such a place, my kidds paid for my self and wife to go for my birthday the thought was there but the hotel just did not make it. Thank god rome was so busy and the weather was good or we would have had to stay in this place and watch the hookers at work. If you have kidds dont bring them hear it not a safe place there are ants all over the room and lose wires and pipes at the loo do not stay in place my wife got sores all over her mouth from drinking from the cups.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel run by bad management”
Reviews.Author: KVRHelsinki
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel with my wife and 4 year old son. Rome was really hot. The hotel assured that the rooms are Air conditioned. The welcome at the reception was o.k. Ater few hours when i complained that AC is not working the lady at the reception answered that she will put it on after 12 O'clock. In the evening when we entered the room to find it really hot because of non functioning AC, the receptionist refused to believe that AC is not working and send a house-keeper to check it. They were willing to return the money back but they did upgrade to the superior room. I would have never agreed to the upgrade had it not been to the politeness of the sweet house keeper girl. In the late evening we spent hour and a half listening to the big quarell between the frustrated customer and the middle aged south-east asian orgin manager (probably owner of the hotel). It seems like the gentleman has never been to school, knows nothing about the customer service and has no etiques and manners of speaking with other individuals especially with a lady. Their breakfast is just a joke. Old over baked bread, cornflakes, ttea ,coffee and butter, jam is all what they have. They probably mixed a litre of milk with 2 liters of water to add up the quantity. The location of the hotel is good it is on a walking distance to the main railway station, the cleaniness of the rooms is basic. The beds were comfortable with clean sheets but don't try to look under the mattresses. Basically, it is a good properity located at a extremly fine location but mostly run by rude careless people. The owner probably doesn't want to invest more in the place and simply doesn't care about anything other than the money. Personally i will never stay in this hotel again. In this particular area there are more than enough hotels available in this price category.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJ2181
Reviews.Content: I am so glad we only stayed one night at this hotel! The room was in need of decorating, air con did not work, very noisy street outside - sounded like the window was open even when closed! No shower screen / curtain, no ventilation in the bathroom. The whole building could do with a makeover. I imagine that once it was an impressive building, but it has now fallen into a state of disrepair. Very strange wallpaper made of material! At about 2am the phone rang - it was the guy at reception asking if there were two of us in the room, because his records showed it was for single occupancy! Thanks for that, could it not have waited until morning?? Breakfast was hideous - the breakfast room is in the basement so it was hot and stuffy, also badly decorated, and breakfast consisted of some cold meat and bread and dodgy cereal. We arrive late at night and left first thing the next morning and that was more than enough time in this awful hotel. I would not recommend it, but if you have to go, try not to spend much time inside.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, not the best”
Reviews.Author: Nicky484
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Nizza. After reading some of the reviews on here I was dreading it. I think people need to remember when they go abroad, thats what they are doing, it isn`t like England or America. When we arrived we were early, we were greeted by a perfectly pleasent italian woman who spoke impeccable english. We asked to check in early, they were just finishing our room so we had to wait 15 minutes in the lounge area. Yes it was dated and could do with a lick of paint but was filled with lovely italian furniture which was old but in keeping with the style of Italy. We were quickly asked if we would like a drink and were given some nibbles, within 15 mins we were given our room, up to now I`m thinking what on earth are these people moaning about. After a short trip in the quirky little lift we arrived at our room. Yes it was very small but it was clean. It had a bed and a shower. There were a few maintenance issues but nothing we couldn`t live with. The staff were pleasant and attentive, I was interested to meet the grumpy night porter but he too was perfectly pleasant with a big smile when we said hello. At the end of the day why are people so concerned with size of room, whether they had a chair, a grumpy porter etc. etc. when they are in Rome for heavens sake. Why on earth would anyone come to Rome and spend a great deal of time in their hotel room. It is a base, somewhere to sleep and wash, whats the problem. The aircon wasn`t brilliant but we just opened the windows. Yes it was slightly noisy in the morning but hey who wants to lie in in a city with so much to see. Also it is near the termini and major travel links if you don`t like noise don`t pick a hotel so close to the main station!! The breakfast left a lot to be desired but hey there are plenty of eateries and stalls very nearby. Considering the location - Its about a fifteen minute walk to many of the major attractions in Rome - and the price of the hotel what were people expecting, as far as I`m concerned if you want to have the best you pay a premium especially in Rome. This hotel is perfectly positioned for sightseeing, eating etc. as its a short distance from 3 of the main roads in Rome. If you tried to get a hotel this well positioned in London for example you wouldn`t pay less than 200 pound a night which is nothing close to what we paid for the Nizza. If you aren`t too fussed about room size and a few teething issues then I would recommend this hotel. For what we paid I was more than happy with what we got.

Reviews.Title: “SLEEP IN A GUTTER. It’s More Comfortable and you’re less likely to Be Robbed.”
Reviews.Author: BrisVegas2
Reviews.Content: DON’T STAY HERE!!! Nizza Hotel is possibly the World’s Filthiest, Most Disreputable Hotel! Hotel Nizza Rome is an unethical establishment that is grossly misrepresenting itself to consumers with false room pictures (aka “bait & switch advertising”). The rooms are filthy and ALL of the staff I spoke with could not have been ruder or less ethical. I booked two nights at Nizza Hotel, Rome through the Hotel Club website. When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by a surly Reception Clerk who requested the Hotel Club voucher, our passports & the FULL payment for both of the two nights of our stay. We were then given the key to Room 119 which backed onto a dirty alley and had all the appeal a crime scene. The walls had not been painted in at least 20yrs, they were heavily watermarked with shoe print marks; the carpet was filthy with nail clippings, dirt & plaster chips all over it; the furnishings were old and tattered; the 1970’s air-conditioner didn’t work and bathroom fittings were falling off the walls. The room looked NOTHING like the pictures on Hotel Club (NOTE: I believe that the ‘bait’ pictures on the websites represent only a few rooms, whilst the majority of rooms are completely different.) We immediately went back to the reception desk to complain and asked see another room. I was given the key to Room 113. This room was even more disgusting than the other as it smelt of smoke, was smaller & darker. I returned this key & told the Reception Clerk that I wished to cancel my second night's stay at the hotel. I would have left immediately had I not been forced to pay for all nights up front. The manager said that I would need to speak with the Hotel Director, Alessandra who would be in reception the next morning. I asked him to make a written note of my cancellation (so that I had given the hotel adequate notice). Later that evening I went to an internet cafe to confirm my cancellation with Hotel Club as per the booking conditions. Upon returning to the hotel I informed the Night Reception Manager of my intention to check out the next morning and desire to be refunded for the second, unused night's accommodation. He was also hostile and told me that he didn't think it would be possible as the room was discounted. He also told me the Hotel Director would be in the next morning. We reluctantly went to back to the room and didn’t sleep under the sheets as there were strands of hair in the bed. Yuck! The following morning we went to the reception to speak with the mysterious Hotel Director (Alessandra) who not surprisingly wasn’t there. I informed yet another Reception Clerk of the events & my desire to check out that morning & be reimbursed for the second night’s accommodation (which would go unused). He was very unhelpful. I asked when the Hotel Director would arrive. He said that she may not be in till the afternoon. I told him that I wished to check out that morning & resolve the matter by being credited one night's accommodation. He said that it was ‘impossible’ as the credit card machine couldn't credit funds back onto customer's cards (WHAT A LIE!). I told him that they could. He flatly refused. I asked him to call Alessandra. After much heated discussion, he phoned someone, spoke in Italian, then told me that he couldn't do it. Not because of any conditions of stay, but because of the credit card machine. This was an outright lie!! I told him that I would happily accept the refund in cash then I'd be on my way. He wouldn't do this either. I asked for the surname of Alessandra (the Hotel Director) which he said he didn't know (HOW IS THIS POSSIBLE??). Finally I told him that he & the hotel were disreputable & unethical, and that I would purse the matter through Hotel Club (aka Flairview Travel). After lodging a written complaint with Hotel Club one of their Quality Assurance Supervisors stated that they were not accustomed to dealing with such unprofessional behavior and lack of cooperation from a hotel and that their management was seriously considering the hotel's tenure on their website. Regrettably five months later Hotel Nizza is STILL listed with Hotel Club and still rated 3 stars. CRAZY! (*3 stars are defined on Hotel Club as, above average quality and range of facilities and services. All rooms will offer a good standard of comfort and equipment.) Nizza Hotel definitely does NOT meet this standard. As a goodwill gesture Hotel Club refunded my prepaid deposit and booking fee but was unable to get Nizza Hotel to refund me for my second (un-used) night’s accommodation. In the words of Hotel Club, Nizza Hotel have proved to be most uncooperative. In my opinion, Nizza Hotel grossly misrepresented itself via bait & switch advertising and acted unethically. I gave both Nizza Hotel and Hotel Club adequate cancellation notice and was unfairly denied a refund. A government organization like romaturismo or turislazio, or even somebody like Enrico Gasbarra, should investigate this business & shut it down. PLEASE do yourself a favor & DON’T stay here! Sleep in the gutter instead. It’s cheaper, more comfortable and you’re less likely to be robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for room selection”
Reviews.Author: Charlie1143
Reviews.Content: We wanted a Hotel within easy reach of the attractions and in that respect the location is excellent. Also the staff were without exception excellent, always cheerful and very helpful. However the room was bad. We had the standard room at over £100 per night. I know Rome is expensive, but this room was not good value. Forget the pictires on the website - they must be the top class rooms or a suite. Our room was very small and poorly furnished. The bathroom door kept catching on the bed. The bathroom itself was old and the shower was very poor. In the bedroom there was hardly room to swing a cat and the bed was unconfortable. One chair only. The TV had only 2 channels. No point in having the remote - I could reach the TV from the bed. Breakfast was fine - typically european and the breakfast room clean and well serviced. I read that the hotel had been refurbished. The outside and entrance foyer had been certainly but not our room. In fairness I should have asked for an alternative room but I suspect the standards room will all be the same. I'd like to have included a opicture - but there wasn't space to take one of any help. We won't stay there again - which is a pity because the staff really were all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: HolidayloverHerts
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was ideally located for the Historic Attractions (about 10 mins walk from the Collesium) the hotel itself was very disappointing. The photos relating to the hotel are obviously very old and bear no resemblance to the hotel as it is now. Room very small and dark but at least the sheets were clean. Overall I think the hotel could do with gutting and recarpeting and decorating. I suppose for the price we shouldn't complain and we were not in it that much.

Reviews.Title: “What's the problem?”
Reviews.Author: PapaBongo
Reviews.Content: I can't see what people are talking about when they describe this 'hell hole hotel'. It was absolutely lovely. My girlfriend and I booked a hotel online on the basis of price (I'd prefer to spend my money on fun on holiday than expensive accomodation) and location (I don't want to have to travel too far to get anywhere if possible). Having booked we read some atrocious reviews and were almost dreading the visit, but such comments were absolute nonsense. We found an attractive, welcoming hotel in a brilliant location and at an unbelievable price. The bus from the airport drops you off about three minutes walk away and it's very easy to find. The receptionist was lovely and spoke perfect English. The room was fine - a clean, made bed, a shower (and soap and towels) and a door that locks - what more do you need!? The bits and bobs that were wrong were absolutely inconsequential (wonky door handle, towel rail fell off, things like that) and didn't even come close to ruining our stay. Noise wasn't a problem, and the room was blissfully dark at night which was great. Breakfast was a simple, continental affair, so as long as you like tea, coffee, cereal and croissants you're fine. Overall, highly recommended to anyone. We paid a great price and were withing 30 mins walk of anywhere we wanted to go in Rome. It's surrounded by lots of nice places to eat as well, so have no qualms about booking into this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellinjo
Reviews.Content: I feel that the Hotel Nizza has had some bad press. For an inexpensive and close to everything kind of hotel it was as expected. The hotel was clean, tidy, traditional and had a feeling of history about it. The lady on the desk when we arrived spoke perfect english and was very hospitable. There were a few bits that, if allowed, could've spoilt our break, such as a broken bathroom door handle and a surly receptionist. But, these minor details were nothing but quite amusing. Overall I would recommend the Hotel Nizza for its great price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: triplover78
Reviews.Content: I had been dreading my trip to Rome after reading the reviews on this hotel. Unfortunately the luxury of changing was not one I could afford so I gritted my teeth and went ahead. Guess what? It turned out not to be the hell hole that so many travellers seem to label it as. It was clean and comfortable, the beds were made and fresh towels and toilettries provided every morning. Ok so the room wasn't huge but if you want the Ritz - pay for the Ritz! Great location for sightseeing and a good choice if you're on a budget and aren't expecting the red carpet treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: ANCLL
Reviews.Content: Bare wires hanging from plug sockets Filthy dirty Stains on bed spreads Breakfast from hell (rather have mcdonalds) Decor appauling Rooms left alot to be desired If you are booking over the internet like we did, this gives you a very false picture of the hotel. There is not one picture on the internet that actually tells the truth. STRONGLY RECOMMEND EVERYBODY NOT TO USE THIS HOTEL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't think I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: MARILYNWILLIS
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Nizza Hotel for 3 nights and i'm glad it wasn't for any longer. I found it to be to close to the train station and main roads as the noise of traffic so early in the morning was terrible. It was also very noisey on my 1st night as i can only assume a hen party took place in a resturant just up the street, and went on for some time so i couldn't get to sleep . It was quite late . Also I was very disappointed with the breakfast so much so that I decided not to go down on my 2nd morning. I was disappointed with the overall decor of the hotel, my room being a single room was small. I could see thick dust on the dressing table, also the wardrobe was no good for hanging long garments, dresses for example as the bottom part of the wardrobe housed the mini-bar. The bath had a shower but no curtain so I usually ended up with water all over the floor. The staff were ok, not very talkative though. All in all I won't be staying in the Nizza again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!! Terrible!! in the World”
Reviews.Author: YUNI
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable unkindness. 2Guys(black,white) and 1 woman's shout to Everytimes. My bed was wet when I get inside room. So I ask change my room, Reception woman shout to and "We have only one room left. but more expensive room, You have to pay 50 euro more!!" What? Bed had been already wet! It's not my fault. I fight 30 minutes. and they throw a Room key.. Reception's are horrible service..I've been Roma every year. Nizza is Worst of Worst My hotel experience

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my time there!”
Reviews.Author: Josephinne
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from my vocations in Rome, where I stayed in Nizza Hotel near Termini Station. This is an OK hotel guys! Traveling on my own to Italy for the first time, I was really scared to go to Nizza after having read the terrible reviews on this site . However, the stay proved to be surprisingly pleasant. The room was neat, spacious and clean. The room had a conditioning system and an ensuite shower/WC. The hotel itself has a beautiful, ultimately Italian, period interior. The notorious night guard proved to be a rather reserved though very pleasant and helpful man. Generally the Italians working in service sector smile half as much as the Americans/ English. If you are not ready for that, do not go to Italy, you'll come back home devastated :). However, if you do not take it personally and be polite and respectful, you will get the same in return. The only thing that was slightly disappointed with was breakfast. Compared to the English continental standard it was quite modest. However, again, keeping in mind that Italians normally have as little as an espresso and a piece of pastry for breakfast, it was quite ok. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay. The location of the hotel is excellent. It's only 5 minutes walk from the train/bus/metro station and you are literally 10 minutes away from almost anywhere in Rome. If you are looking for an ultimately Italian experience and do not want to spend a fortune on the accomodation, there are good chances that you will enjoy your stay in Nizza.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last June 22 and yes all the staff are extremely rude. None of them are polite. The rooms are in bad condition and the carpet is extremely dirty. There are other hotels near this hotel where one can stay...but definitely not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Musolini is back... and is the manager at Nizza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I ve just returned from a 3 day stay in the Nizza hotel Rome. It is by far far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Not so much about the awful state of most of the rooms but mostly because of the unexplainable hostility shown by the staff of the hotel. If you want to be insulted and ignored by rude Italian people then Nizza is definitely the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A hotel in a bad condition, with very rude staff and uncomfortable rooms that cannot even provide the basics.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back (2nd. Feb.06)from a three night stay at the Nizza Hotel . We had a second floor double room that was clean , and was of adequate size with adequate storage space for our 3 night visit. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times , they also speak several languages. The location was good , great for Termini ( you have just to survive crossing the roads ha ha !!). Breakfast was pretty basic but overall I would rate the Nizza as excellent value for money and would make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away, They are Keen on Ruining Your Vacation !”
Reviews.Author: hieronimus
Reviews.Content: Way below an average 3-star, the impression of the establishment is only complemented with the unfriendly staff and poor hygiene. The sheets are dirty, the roof is leaking, the receptionists are lazy, the room maids tends to skip some rooms. I have been in over 100 hotels worldwide, and this is the first time I've bothered to write a comment - it IS that bad!

Reviews.Title: “It is very, very good 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all when I read last posts about Nizza hotel I was afraid to go there but I did have no choice. We arrived to airport "Fiumicino" and then with Leonardo da Vinci train to Termini. From Termini we took a 5 min walk to hotel which is very easy to find. When we enter the room I was very surprised because the room was very big. Bathroom is also very good with lots of towel's and they change them every day, they have hair dryer and very big mirror .You can always find hot water butt faucet is a little bit strange and it takes time to understand how it works. Just adjust temperature and let water to go for a while and you get hot water.T he hotel is at extremly good position to all metro and bus stations and all historical places, butt I sugest you to take a walk and to see all things in Rome simply just by walking because everything is very near. Breakfast is good butt after couple of days you can find it is boring. Maybe I can give a better mark I think it is betwen 3 and 4 balls. The working people in Hotel is very pleasant and always with smile. At the end of vacation we leave our luggage at hotel because we have late flight and take walk and after that collect our bags an leave this beautiful town.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere nicer than the Nizza!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My room was in the basement. Air conditioning made a lot of noise and didn't work, I was next to the hotel generator so had to keep the window closed. The room stank of stale cigarettes as did the bed. There were brown stains on all the walls particularly over my bed. Find somewhere nice than the Nizza.

HotelInfo.Address: Via Massimo D'Azeglio 16, 00184 Rome, Italy
